utterance: Carolina Tropini-UBC (she/her): Hi, I'm Carolina Tropini. I'm at the University of British Columbia in Vancouver, um in uh in Canada. And my lab studies the effects of the the physical environment on the gut microbiota from the perspective of uh measuring how both the microbes can modify the environment themselves by producing metabolites, changing the osmolality as well as changing uh properties like the pH, but also is modulated uh by the environment uh because certain species will not be able to uh to grow at the same rate uh depending on how these physical factors are changed. And we find that these physical factors are really important uh in understanding uh diseases such as uh inflammatory bowel disease in which uh not only is there a strong inflammatory response, but there's also very important local changes such as uh oxidative stress, uh local changes in temperature if there's inflammation, uh changes in pH uh and malabsorption.

annotations.signal expertise: Carolina explicitly states her and her lab's expertise in the field.
